00040 uint8_t loTarVal[5][2] = {{0x59, 0x68},         /* current value */
00041                             {0x59, 0x68},           /* Channel 0: 2.44175 GHz, center of the band,
00042                                                                         shall be used for 80 MHz mode */
00043 #ifdef COUNTRY_CODE_1
00044 /* USA */
00045                             {0x66, 0x62},           /* Channel 0: 2.412 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( USA ) */
00046                             {0x66, 0x67},           /* Channel 5: 2.437 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( USA ) */
00047                             {0x66, 0x6c}            /* Channel 10: 2.462 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( USA ) */
00048 #else
00049 /* COUNTRY_CODE_2 */
00050 /* EUROPE */
00051                             {0x66, 0x62},           /* Channel 0: 2.412 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( Europe ) */
00052                             {0x66, 0x68},           /* Channel 6: 2.442 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( Europe ) */
00053                             {0x66, 0x6e}            /* Channel 12: 2.472 GHz non overlapping chanel no. ( Europe ) */
00054 #endif
00055 };
00056 
00057 
00058 uint8_t loTarValTx[2] = {0x59, 0x68};           /* current value */
00059 uint8_t loTarValRx[2] = {0x6f, 0x68};           /* current value */
00060 
00061 #ifdef CONFIG_DEFAULT_TRX_80MHZ_1000NS
00062 uint8_t loTarValRx_418kHz[] = {0x6f, 0x68};
00063 #endif
00064 #ifndef CONFIG_DEFAULT_TRX_80MHZ_1000NS
00065 uint8_t loTarValRx_418kHz[] = {0x5c, 0x68};
00066 #endif

00068 uint8_t ntrxShadowReg[SHADOWREGCOUNT];  /**< shadow register for the nanoLOC chip. Needed for write-only register */
00069 PhyModeSetT modeSet;                        /**< group of parameters that define a transmission mode. */
00070 uint8_t     ntrxIrqStatus[2];               /**< interrupt status register */
00071 uint8_t   ntrxBBStatus; /**< baseband status register */
00072 uint8_t   ntrxState;                        /**< state of the nanoLOC chip */
00073 uint8_t     lfdma = 0, lsd = 0, lsr = 0;    /**< ranging variables */
00074 
00075 uint8_t tx_caps[3]={0,0,0}, rx_caps[3]={0,0,0}; /**< used for fake calibration */
00076 
00077 uint8_t     ntrxInitShadowReg[] PROGMEM =
00078 {
00079 /* 0x00 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   6,
00080 /* 0x08 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,
00081 /* 0x10 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,  64,   0,
00082 /* 0x18 */  32,  64,   0,  32,   0,   0,   0,   3,
00083 /* 0x20 */   6, 152,  12,   0,   2,  63,  30,   6,
00084 /* 0x28 */   0,   0, 171,  44, 213, 146, 148, 202,
00085 /* 0x30 */ 105, 171,  48,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,
00086 /* 0x38 */   0,   0,   0,   0, 224,   4,   0,   1,
00087 /* 0x40 */   3,   7,   0,   3,  63,  63,  15,  15,
00088 /* 0x48 */ 115,   0,  16,  16,  67,  20,  16,   0,
00089 /* 0x50 */   0, 127,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,
00090 /* 0x58 */   0,   0,  11,  95,   5,   7, 213,  98,
00091 /* 0x60 */   0,   0,   0,  12,  10,   0,   0,   0,
00092 /* 0x68 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,
00093 /* 0x70 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,
00094 /* 0x78 */   0,   0,   0,   0,   0,  80,   0,   0
00095 };

00097 /**
00098  * @brief resets the transmission mode parameters.
00099  *
00100  * This function sets the three parameters that define a transmission mode.
00101  *
00102  */
00103 /**************************************************************************/
00104 void NTRXResetSettings (void)
00105 /**************************************************************************/
00106 {
00107     lfdma   = 0;
00108     lsd     = 0;
00109     lsr     = 0;
00110 }

00112 /**
00113  * @brief initialize shadow registers.
00114  *
00115  * This function initializes the shadow register array to the initial
00116  * values in the transceiver when it is powered up or reset.
00117  *
00118  */
00119 /**************************************************************************/
00120 void NTRXInitShadowRegister (void)
00121 /**************************************************************************/
00122 {
00123     uint8_t i;
00124 
00125     /*
00126      * set shadow registers to the initial value of the nanoNET TRX chip
00127      */
00128     for (i = 0; i < SHADOWREGCOUNT; i++)
00129     {
00130         ntrxShadowReg[i] = ReadRomByte(ntrxInitShadowReg[i]);
00131     }
00132 }
00133 
00134 /**
00135  * @brief set the logical channel.
00136  * @param value the logical channel id
00137  *
00138  * This function sets the logical channel for transmission and reception
00139  *
00140  */
00141 /**************************************************************************/
00142 void NTRXSetChannel (uint8_t value)
00143 /**************************************************************************/
00144 {
00145     /*
00146      * first check for a valid parameter. If the parameter is out of range
00147      * do nothing.
00148      */
00149     if (value > NTRX_MAX_CHANNEL_ID)
00150         return;
00151 
00152     /*
00153      * in the first slot of the loTarVal array the currently used channel
00154      * (center frequency) is stored. The other 4 are used to hold the
00155      * predefined channels. When a new channel is selected, the value
00156      * is copied form the list to the first slot. For fdma only the first
00157      * channel is stored. The other 14 channels are calculated with the
00158      * first channel as the basis.
00159      */
00160     switch (value)
00161     {
00162         case 0: loTarValTx[0] = loTarVal[1][0];
00163                 loTarValTx[1] = loTarVal[1][1];
00164                 loTarValRx[0] = loTarValRx_418kHz[0];
00165                 loTarValRx[1] = loTarValRx_418kHz[1];
00166                 break;
00167 
00168         default:
00169                 loTarValTx[0] = loTarVal[1 + value][0];
00170                 loTarValTx[1] = loTarVal[1 + value][1];
00171                 loTarValRx[0] = loTarVal[1 + value][0];
00172                 loTarValRx[1] = loTarVal[1 + value][1];
00173                 break;
00174 
00175 
00176     }
00177 }
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * @brief set the index register.
00181  * @param page address index
00182  *
00183  * This function sets the index registers for the transceiver chip.
00184  * The chip address space is deviced into 4 sections a 1kbyte.
00185  *
00186  */
00187 /**************************************************************************/
00188 void NTRXSetIndexReg (uint8_t page)
00189 /**************************************************************************/
00190 {
00191     if (page != ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O])
00192     {
00193         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O] = page;
00194         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RamIndex_O, page);
00195     }
00196 }
00197 
00198 /**
00199  * @brief set the index register.
00200  * @param page address index
00201  *
00202  * This function sets the index registers for the transceiver chip
00203  * The chip address space is deviced into 4 sections a 1kbyte.
00204  *
00205  */
00206 /**************************************************************************/
00207 void NTRXSetRamIndex (uint8_t page)
00208 /**************************************************************************/
00209 {
00210     page &= 0x03;
00211     if (page != (ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O] & 0x03))
00212     {
00213         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O] &= 0xf0;
00214         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O] |= page;
00215         page = ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O];
00216         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RamIndex_O, page);
00217     }
00218 }
00219 
00220 /**
00221  * @brief calibrates the local ocsillator.
00222  *
00223  * This function callibrates the local oscillator of the receiver part.
00224  * It is not called directly but from within the NTRXAllCalibration
00225  * function.
00226  *
00227  */
00228 /**************************************************************************/
00229 void NTRXRxLoCalibration (void)
00230 /**************************************************************************/
00231 {
00232     uint8_t data[3];
00233 
00234     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00235 
00236     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] | (1 << NA_EnableLO_B) | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B)));
00237 
00238 
00239     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_UseLoRxCaps_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_UseLoRxCaps_O] | (1 << NA_UseLoRxCaps_B)));
00240 
00241     data[0] = 0x03;
00242     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_LoIntsReset_O, data[0]);
00243     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_LoTargetValue_O, loTarValRx, 2);
00244 
00245     do
00246     {
00247         NTRXSPIReadByte (NA_LoIntsRawStat_O, &data[0]);
00248     } while ((data[0] & (1 << NA_LoTuningReady_B)) != (1 << NA_LoTuningReady_B));
00249 
00250     /* Read out caps values if needed */
00251     //NTRXSPIRead (0x16, data, 3);
00252     NTRXSPIRead (0x16, rx_caps, 3);
00253 
00254     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_UseLoRxCaps_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_UseLoRxCaps_O]);
00255     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00256 
00257     /*
00258      * start receiver if it was started before calibration
00259      */
00260     if (phyPIB.rxState == PHY_RX_ON) NTRXRXEnable(TRUE);
00261 }
00262 
00263 /**
00264  * @brief calibrates the local ocsillator.
00265  *
00266  * This function callibrates the local oscillator of the transmitter part.
00267  * It is not called directly but from within the NTRXAllCalibration
00268  * function.
00269  *
00270  */
00271 /**************************************************************************/
00272 void NTRXTxLoCalibration (void)
00273 /**************************************************************************/
00274 {
00275     uint8_t data[3];
00276 
00277     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00278 
00279     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] | (1 << NA_EnableLO_B) | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B)));
00280 
00281 
00282     data[0] = 0x03;
00283     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_LoIntsReset_O, data[0]);
00284 
00285     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_LoTargetValue_O, loTarValTx, 2);
00286 
00287     do
00288     {
00289         NTRXSPIReadByte (NA_LoIntsRawStat_O, &(data[0]));
00290     } while ((data[0] & (1 << NA_LoTuningReady_B)) != (1 << NA_LoTuningReady_B));
00291 
00292     /* Read out caps values if needed */
00293     //NTRXSPIRead (0x19, data, 3);
00294     NTRXSPIRead (0x19, tx_caps, 3);
00295 
00296     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00297 
00298     /*
00299      * start receiver if it was started before calibration
00300      */
00301     if (phyPIB.rxState == PHY_RX_ON) NTRXRXEnable(TRUE);
00302 }
00303 
00304 /**
00305  * @brief copy values from last calibration into chip.
00306  */
00307 /**************************************************************************/
00308 bool_t NTRXAllFakeCalibration (void)
00309 /**************************************************************************/
00310 {
00311     NTRXSPIWrite (0x16, rx_caps, 3);
00312     NTRXSPIWrite (0x19, tx_caps, 3);
00313     return TRUE;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * @brief calibrates the local ocsillator.
00318  *
00319  * This function callibrates the local oscillator for both the transmitter
00320  * and the receiver part. This function should be called regularly to maintain
00321  * a stable and in spec transmission.
00322  *
00323  */
00324 /**************************************************************************/
00325 bool_t NTRXAllCalibration (void)
00326 /**************************************************************************/
00327 {
00328     /*
00329      * make sure the we are not currently transmitting. This would destroy
00330      * the partialy send message.
00331      */
00332     if (ntrxState == TxSEND) return FALSE;
00333 
00334     /*
00335      * stop the receiver and clear the buffers
00336      */
00337     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00338 
00339     /*
00340      * calibrate transmitter and receiver
00341      */
00342     NTRXRxLoCalibration ();
00343     NTRXTxLoCalibration ();
00344 
00345     /*
00346      * start receiver if it was started before calibration
00347      */
00348     if (phyPIB.rxState == PHY_RX_ON)
00349     {
00350         NTRXRXEnable(TRUE);
00351     }
00352     return TRUE;
00353 }
00354 
00355 /**
00356  * @brief read out version an revision of the transceiver chip.
00357  * @returns TRUE if equal, False if not equal or SPI access failed.
00358  *
00359  * This function compares the version and revision register with
00360  * the expected Version and Revision number from the software.
00361  *
00362  */
00363 /**************************************************************************/
00364 bool_t NTRXCheckVerRev (void)
00365 /**************************************************************************/
00366 {
00367     uint8_t buff[2];
00368 
00369     NTRXSPIRead (NA_Version_O, buff, 1);
00370     NTRXSPIRead (NA_Revision_O, &(buff[1]), 1);
00371 
00372 #   if ((CONFIG_PRINTF) && (CONFIG_LOGO))
00373     DEBUG_PHY("ver:%d, rev:%d\n", buff[0], buff[1]);
00374 #   endif
00375 
00376     if (buff[0] == NA_Version_I && buff[1] == NA_Revision_I)
00377     {
00378         return TRUE;
00379     }
00380     else
00381     {
00382         return FALSE;
00383     }
00384 }
00385 
00386 /**
00387  * @brief read out number of retransmission attempts.
00388  * @returns tx arq maximum value in the range of (0x0...0xE).
00389  *
00390  * This function returns the number of packet retransmissions used by
00391  * the nanoLOC chip.
00392  * The value is taken from the shadow ram.
00393  *
00394  */
00395 /**************************************************************************/
00396 uint8_t NTRXGetTxArqMax (void)
00397 /**************************************************************************/
00398 {
00399     return (uint8_t)((ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxArqMax_O] >> 4) & 0x0f);
00400 }
00401 
00402 /**
00403  * @brief returns the setting vor the CRC-2 mode of the transceiver chip.
00404  * @returns On (TRUE) or Off (FALSE).
00405  *
00406  * This function returns the CRC-2 mode settings in the transceiver chip.
00407  * The value is taken from the shadow ram.
00408  */
00409 /**************************************************************************/
00410 bool_t NTRXGetRxCrc2Mode (void)
00411 /**************************************************************************/
00412 {
00413     return ((bool_t)((ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxCrc2Mode_O] & (1<< NA_RxCrc2Mode_B)) >> NA_RxCrc2Mode_B));
00414 }
00415 
00416 
00417 
00418 /**
00419  * @brief sets the capacitors to tune the frequency.
00420  *
00421  * This function executes the recommended procedure to tune the frequency
00422  * by en- and disableing capacitors.
00423  */
00424 /**************************************************************************/
00425 void NTRXFctCal (void)
00426 /**************************************************************************/
00427 {
00428     int capsVal = 7;
00429     int targetValMax = 174;
00430     int targetValMin = 152;
00431     int fctSum = 0;
00432     int ctref;
00433     unsigned char payload;
00434 
00435     payload = ( 1 << NA_FctClockEn_B ) | capsVal;
00436     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O, payload);
00437     HWDelayus( 10 ); /* 10 us */
00438 
00439     while ((capsVal < 16) && (capsVal >= 0))
00440     {
00441         fctSum = 0;
00442         for (ctref = 0; ctref < 4; ctref++)
00443         {
00444             payload = (uint8_t)(( 1 << NA_FctClockEn_B ) | ( 1 << NA_StartFctMeasure_B ) | capsVal );
00445             NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O, payload);
00446             HWDelayus( 15 ); /* 10 us */
00447 
00448             NTRXSPIReadByte (NA_FctPeriod_O, &payload);
00449             fctSum += payload;
00450         }
00451         if (fctSum >= targetValMax)
00452         {
00453             capsVal--;
00454         }
00455         else if (fctSum <= targetValMin)
00456         {
00457             capsVal++;
00458         }
00459         else
00460         {
00461             payload = (uint8_t)( capsVal );
00462             ntrxShadowReg[NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O] = payload;
00463             NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O, payload);
00464             return;
00465         }
00466     }
00467     payload = 6;
00468     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O] = payload;
00469     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ChirpFilterCaps_O, payload);
00470 }
00471 
00472 /**
00473  * @brief sets the sync word in the transceiver.
00474  * @param value a pointer to the 8 byte syncword.
00475  *
00476  * This function writes the syncword in the syncword register.
00477  * The syncword is used for add a transceivers to a logical
00478  * group. Only messages with the right syncword are detected
00479  * (received) and processed.
00480  */
00481 /**************************************************************************/
00482 void NTRXSetSyncWord (uint8_t *value)
00483 /**************************************************************************/
00484 {
00485     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_SyncWord_O, value, 8);
00486 }
00487 
00488 /**
00489  * @brief sets transmission mode in the transceiver.
00490  * @param fdma this parameter determines the the mode (fdma or 80 MHz)
00491  * @param sd this parameter determines the symbol duration between 500ns and 8us)
00492  * @param sr this parameter determines the symbol rate between 125kbit and 2Mbit)
00493  *
00494  * Based on the three parameters the transceiver is initialized.
00495  * The iq parameter are set and the nanoLOC chip is calibrated.
00496  *
00497  */
00498 /**************************************************************************/
00499 void NTRXSetupTrxMode (uint8_t fdma, uint8_t sd, uint8_t sr)
00500 /**************************************************************************/
00501 {
00502     modeSet.bw = fdma;
00503     modeSet.sd = sd;
00504     modeSet.sr = sr;
00505 
00506 #   ifndef CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM
00507     if (fdma == NA_22MHz)
00508     {
00509         modeSet.fdma= TRUE;
00510         modeSet.fixnmap=NA_FIX_MODE;
00511 
00512         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueI_O] |= (0x0f << NA_RfRxCompValueI_LSB);
00513         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueQ_O] |= (0x0f << NA_RfRxCompValueQ_LSB);
00514     }
00515     else
00516     {
00517         modeSet.fdma= FALSE;
00518         modeSet.fixnmap=NA_FIX_MODE;
00519 
00520         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueI_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(0x0f << NA_RfRxCompValueI_LSB ));
00521         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueI_O] |= (uint8_t)( (0x0e << NA_RfRxCompValueI_LSB ));
00522         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueQ_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(0x0f << NA_RfRxCompValueQ_LSB ));
00523         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueQ_O] |= (uint8_t)( (0x0e << NA_RfRxCompValueQ_LSB ));
00524     }
00525     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RfRxCompValueI_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueI_O] );
00526     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RfRxCompValueQ_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_RfRxCompValueQ_O] );
00527 #   else
00528     modeSet.fdma = TRUE;
00529     modeSet.fixnmap = NA_FIX_MODE;
00530 #   endif /* CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM */
00531 
00532     if( phyPIB.pwrUp == FALSE )
00533     {
00534         if (ntrxShadowReg[NA_RamIndex_O] != 0)
00535         {
00536             NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RamIndex_O, 0);
00537         }
00538         NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00539 
00540         /* switch off diio functions to save more power*/
00541         ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O] = 0x01;
00542         NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioDirection_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O]);
00543         NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, 0xf );
00544         NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, 0);
00545     }
00546     else
00547     {
00548         //phyPIB.rxState = PHY_RX_ON;
00549         phyPIB.rxState = PHY_TRX_OFF;
00550         phyPIB.pwrUp = FALSE;
00551     }
00552 
00553 #   ifndef CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM
00554     /* first part of initial register setting */
00555     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbClockGate_O] |= (1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B);
00556     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbCrystal_B);
00557     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, 2);
00558     HWDelayms( 5 ); /* 5 ms */ /* TODO: is this needed?? */
00559     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbClockGate_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B));
00560     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbClock_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbClock_B);
00561     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, 2);
00562     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_O, (1 << NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_B));
00563     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, 0);
00564 #   else
00565     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbCrystal_B);
00566     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbClock_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbClock_B);
00567 
00568     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbClockGate_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B));
00569     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_B));
00570     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, 2);
00571 #   endif /* CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM */
00572 
00573 
00574 #   ifndef CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM
00575     /* Tx Part */
00576     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxArqMax_O] = (CONFIG_MAX_ARQ << NA_TxArqMax_LSB);
00577     ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~((1 << NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_B)
00578                             | (1 << NA_CsqAsyMode_B)));
00579     ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUseRam_O] |= (1 << NA_CsqUseRam_B);
00580     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_TxArqMax_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_TxArqMax_O, 2);
00581 
00582     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~((1 << NA_EnableLO_B) | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B)));
00583     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] |= ((1 << NA_EnableExtPA_B)
00584                             | (1 << NA_EnableCsqClock_B));
00585     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_EnableExtPA_O, 7);
00586     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxScrambEn_O] |= (1 << NA_TxScrambEn_B);
00587     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxAddrSlct_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_TxAddrSlct_B));
00588     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_TxArq_O, ntrxShadowReg + NA_TxArq_O , 7);
00589 #   else
00590     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableExtPA_B);
00591     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxArqMax_O] );
00592 #   endif
00593 
00594     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxCrc2Mode_O] |= (NA_RxCrc2ModeTrigOn_BC_C << NA_RxCrc2Mode_B);
00595     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxTimeBCrc1Mode_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(NA_RxTimeBCrc1ModeOn_BC_C << NA_RxTimeBCrc1Mode_B));
00596     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_RxArqMode_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxArqMode_O] );
00597 
00598 #   ifdef CONFIG_NTRX_SNIFFER
00599     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxAddrMode_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_RxAddrMode_B));
00600     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_RxAddrMode_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxAddrMode_O] );
00601 #   endif
00602 
00603     /* enable fast calibration tuning */
00604     ntrxShadowReg[NA_LoEnableFastTuning_O] =
00605         (1 << NA_LoEnableFastTuning_B) |
00606         (1 << NA_LoEnableLsbNeg_B) |
00607         (4 << NA_LoFastTuningLevel_LSB);
00608     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_LoEnableFastTuning_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_LoEnableFastTuning_O]);
00609 
00610 
00611 
00612     NTRXFctCal ();
00613 
00614 #   ifndef CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM
00615     NTRXSetRxIqMatrix (fdma, sd);
00616 #   endif
00617     NTRXSetCorrThreshold (fdma, sd);
00618 #   ifndef CONFIG_IQ_MATRIX_ROM
00619     NTRXSetTxIqMatrix (fdma, sd);
00620 #   endif
00621     NTRXSetSyncWord((uint8_t *)phyPIB.syncword);
00622 
00623 #   ifdef CONFIG_NTRX_AUTO_RECALIB
00624     NTRXAllCalibration ();
00625 #   endif /* CONFIG_NTRX_AUTO_RECALIB */
00626 
00627     NTRXSetAgcValues (fdma, sd, sr);
00628 
00629     ntrxShadowReg[NA_GateSizeFramesync_O]  = ((NA_GateSize9Slots_VC_C << NA_GateSizeFramesync_LSB)
00630                             | (NA_GateSize9Slots_VC_C << NA_GateSizeUnsync_LSB)
00631                             | (NA_GateSize9Slots_VC_C << NA_GateSizeBitsync_LSB)
00632                             | ( 1 << NA_GateAdjBitsyncEn_B )
00633                             );
00634 
00635     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_GateSizeFramesync_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_GateSizeFramesync_O] );
00636 
00637     PHYInit ();
00638 
00639     lfdma   = fdma;
00640     lsd     = sd;
00641     lsr     = sr;
00642 }
00643 
00644 
00645 /**
00646  * @brief read out the real time clock of the transceiver.
00647  * @param force == TRUE lets the function read the RTC anyway
00648  * @returns the time in 1/32768 seconds (ca. 30 us)
00649  *
00650  * This function reads out the real time clock of the transceiver
00651  *
00652  */
00653 /**************************************************************************/
00654 uint32_t NTRXGetRtc (bool_t force)
00655 /**************************************************************************/
00656 {
00657     /*FIXME disabled for debugging!*/
00658     static uint32_t currentRTC;                 /**< stores the last RTC value*/
00659     static uint32_t currentHwclock = 0xFFFFFFFF;    /**< stores the hwclock value when RTC was read*/
00660     uint32_t now = hwclock();
00661 
00662     /*
00663     Avoid redundant access to RTC to save time.
00664     force == TRUE lets the function read the RTC anyway.
00665     */
00666     if ((now != currentHwclock) || (force))
00667     {
00668         uint8_t rtc[5];
00669         uint8_t reg;
00670 
00671 
00672         /*read current RTC*/
00673         ENTER_TASK;
00674         reg = (uint8_t)( ntrxShadowReg[NA_RtcCmdRd_O] | ( 1 << NA_RtcCmdRd_B ));
00675         NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_RtcCmdRd_O, reg);
00676         HWDelayus( 130 );
00677         NTRXSPIRead(NA_RamRtcReg_O + 1, rtc, 4);
00678         reg = 0;
00679         NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_RtcCmdRd_O, reg);
00680 
00681         /*update current RTC and hwclock entries*/
00682         currentRTC = (
00683                 (((uint32_t)rtc[0])   <<  0)
00684                 | (((uint32_t)rtc[1]) <<  8)
00685                 | (((uint32_t)rtc[2]) << 16)
00686                 | (((uint32_t)rtc[3]) << 24)
00687         );
00688         currentHwclock = now;
00689         LEAVE_TASK;
00690     }
00691     return currentRTC;
00692 }
00693 
00694 /**
00695  * @brief read out the real time clock of the transceiver.
00696  * @param mode 0 is full and 1 is for pad mode
00697  * @param seconds wake up time from now
00698  *
00699  * This function starts the alarm clock if the parameter seconds is
00700  * greater than 0 and brings the transceiver into the requested powerdown mode.
00701  * There are two powerdown modes supported: powerdown mode full and
00702  * powerdown mode pad. The second mode can be used to supervise the dig-IO
00703  * pins of the nanoLOC chip.
00704  *
00705  */
00706 /**************************************************************************/
00707 void NTRXPowerdownMode (uint8_t mode, uint32_t ms)
00708 /**************************************************************************/
00709 {
00710     uint8_t     value, valNull = 0;
00711     uint8_t     i;
00712     uint8_t     wakeupTime8;
00713     uint32_t wakeupTime32;
00714 
00715     /*Stop receiver*/
00716     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00717 
00718     if (ms > 0)
00719     {
00720         ms = (uint32_t)( ms / (float) 7.8125 ); /* 7.8125ms steps */
00721         /* Round errors leads to always to short measurements.
00722          * add +1 to be sure not to sleep shorter than expected */
00723         ms += 1;
00724 
00725         wakeupTime32 = ms + NTRXGetRtc(TRUE);
00726 
00727         /*write down wake up time*/
00728         for (i = NA_WakeUpTimeWe_LSB; i <= NA_WakeUpTimeWe_MSB; i++)
00729         {
00730 
00731             /*convert 32bit integer wakeup time -> RTC value*/
00732             wakeupTime8 = (uint8_t)(wakeupTime32 & 0xFF);
00733             wakeupTime32 >>= 8;
00734 
00735             /*write one of the 3 bytes into the RtcWakeUpTime Register*/
00736             NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_WakeUpTimeByte_O, wakeupTime8 );
00737 
00738             /*generate Strobe to store value in the right place*/
00739             value = (uint8_t)( 1 << i);
00740             NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_WakeUpTimeWe_O, value );
00741             NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_WakeUpTimeWe_O, valNull );
00742         }
00743     }
00744 
00745     value = ( 0x00 | ( 1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B ));
00746     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_PowerDown_O, value );
00747     value = 0;
00748     NTRXSPIWriteByte( 0x8, value );
00749     /*set wakeup parameter*/
00750     if (ms > 0)
00751     {
00752         value = (uint8_t)((0x00
00753             | ( 1 << NA_EnableWakeUpRtc_B )
00754             | ( 1 << NA_PowerUpTime_LSB )
00755             | (( 0x01 & mode ) << NA_PowerDownMode_B )));
00756     }
00757     else
00758     {
00759         value = (uint8_t)((( 0x01 & mode ) << NA_PowerDownMode_B ));
00760     }
00761     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_EnableWakeUpRtc_O, value );
00762 
00763     value =(0x00
00764             | ( 1 << NA_PowerDown_B )
00765             | ( 1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B ));
00766     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_PowerDown_O, value );
00767     phyPIB.pwrUp = TRUE;
00768     phyPIB.pwrDown = TRUE;
00769 }
00770 
00771 /**
00772  * @brief starts the baseband timer.
00773  * @param startvalue countdown value in us
00774  *
00775  * Starts a countdown from startvalue to zero ( in us )
00776  *
00777  */
00778 /**************************************************************************/
00779 void NTRXStartBbTimer (int16_t startvalue)
00780 /**************************************************************************/
00781 {
00782     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_BasebandTimerStartValue_O, (uint8_t *)(&startvalue), 2);
00783 }
00784 
00785 /**
00786  * @brief stops the baseband timer.
00787  *
00788  * Stops the baseband timer. The baseband timer is recommended for very
00789  * short timer intervals < 1 ms
00790  *
00791  */
00792 /**************************************************************************/
00793 void NTRXStopBbTimer (void)
00794 /**************************************************************************/
00795 {
00796     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ClearBasebandTimerInt_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_ClearBasebandTimerInt_O] | (1 << NA_ClearBasebandTimerInt_B)));
00797 }
00798 
00799 /**
00800  * @brief Testmode for chip measurement.
00801  *
00802  * This function enables or disables the chip test mode. In this mode
00803  * a continuous chirp is transmitted. This requires to swich off the receiver.
00804  * Note: This function should be interrupted periodically and the transmitter
00805  * recalibrated. Otherwise the frequency might be out of range.
00806  */
00807 /**************************************************************************/
00808 void NTRXSetTestChirpMode (bool_t value)
00809 /**************************************************************************/
00810 {
00811     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00812 
00813     if (value == TRUE)
00814     {
00815         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O] |= (1 << NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_B);
00816         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O]);
00817 
00818         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] |= ((1 << NA_EnableLO_B) | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B) | (1 << NA_EnableCsqClock_B));
00819         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00820 
00821         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableTx_B);
00822         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableTx_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O]);
00823 
00824         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] |= 0x20;
00825         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O]);
00826 
00827         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUseRam_O] |= 0x80;
00828         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqUseRam_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUseRam_O]);
00829     }
00830     else
00831     {
00832         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUseRam_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(0x80));
00833         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqUseRam_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUseRam_O]);
00834 
00835         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(0x20));
00836         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O]);
00837 
00838         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableTx_B));
00839         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableTx_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O]);
00840 
00841         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableCsqClock_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableCsqClock_B));
00842         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLOdiv10_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B));
00843         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableLO_B));
00844         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00845 
00846         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_B));
00847         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqUsePhaseShift_O]);
00848     }
00849 }
00850 
00851 /**
00852  * @brief Carriermode for chip measurement.
00853  *
00854  *
00855  *
00856  * This function enables or disables the unmodulated carrier signal test mode by
00857  * sending a continuous carrier. This requires to swich off the receiver.
00858  * Note: This function should be periodically interrupted and the transmitter
00859  * recalibrated. Otherwise the frequency might be out of range.
00860  */
00861 /**************************************************************************/
00862 void NTRXSetTestCarrierMode (bool_t value)
00863 /**************************************************************************/
00864 {
00865     static uint8_t fdma;
00866 
00867     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00868 
00869     if (value == TRUE)
00870     {
00871         fdma = ntrxShadowReg[NA_FdmaEnable_O];
00872         ntrxShadowReg[NA_FdmaEnable_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_FdmaEnable_B));
00873         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_FdmaEnable_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_FdmaEnable_O]);
00874 
00875         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] |= ((1 << NA_EnableLO_B) | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B));
00876         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00877 
00878         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O] = 0x1F;
00879         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqSetValue_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O]);
00880 
00881         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O] |= (1 << 6);
00882         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqSetValue_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O]);
00883 
00884         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O] = 0x3F;
00885         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqSetValue_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O]);
00886 
00887         ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O] |= (1 << 7);
00888         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_CsqSetValue_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_CsqSetValue_O]);
00889 
00890         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableTx_B);
00891         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableTx_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O]);
00892 
00893         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] |= 0x20;
00894         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O]);
00895     }
00896     else
00897     {
00898         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(0x20));
00899         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableExtPA_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableExtPA_O]);
00900 
00901         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableTx_B));
00902         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableTx_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableTx_O]);
00903 
00904         ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~((1 << NA_EnableLO_B)
00905                                             | (1 << NA_EnableLOdiv10_B)
00906                                             | (1 << NA_EnableCsqClock_B)));
00907         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O]);
00908 
00909         ntrxShadowReg[NA_FdmaEnable_O] = fdma;
00910         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_FdmaEnable_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_FdmaEnable_O]);
00911     }
00912 }
00913 
00914 
00915 /**************************************************************************/
00916 void NTRXPowerupFromPadMode( void )
00917 /**************************************************************************/
00918 {
00919     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbCrystal_B);
00920     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableBbCrystal_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O]);
00921 
00922     HWDelayms( 5 ); /* 5 ms */
00923 
00924     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, 0);
00925 
00926     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbClock_O] |= (1 << NA_EnableBbClock_B);
00927     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableBbCrystal_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O]);
00928 }
00929 
00930 /**************************************************************************/
00931 void NTRXPowerdownModeDIO( uint8_t mode , uint8_t dio )
00932 /**************************************************************************/
00933 {
00934     /*Stop receiver*/
00935     NTRXRXEnable(FALSE);
00936 
00937 
00938     // enable DIGIO for wake-up alarm, start the alarm function,
00939     // rising edge causes the alarm, configure as an input pin
00940     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O] =  ( 1 << NA_DioOutValueAlarmEnable_B )
00941                                       | ( 1 << NA_DioAlarmStart_B )
00942                                       | ( 1 << NA_DioAlarmPolarity_B );
00943     NTRXSPIWriteByte ( NA_DioDirection_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O] );
00944 
00945     // apply settings to DIGIO port
00946     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioPortWe_O] = (uint8_t)(1 << dio);
00947     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_DioPortWe_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioPortWe_O]);
00948     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioPortWe_O] = 0;
00949     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_DioPortWe_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioPortWe_O]); // clear the write enable register
00950 
00951     // alarm source for powering up is DIGIO, power down mode as selected with parameter mode,
00952     // power up time is set (ticks)
00953     // 1 tick = 1/4096s ~= 244us
00954     // reg. 0x06 is R/W
00955     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableWakeUpDio_O] = (uint8_t)(( 1 << NA_EnableWakeUpDio_B )
00956                                         | ( NA_PowerUpTime1Ticks_C << NA_PowerUpTime_LSB )
00957                                         | ((mode & 0x01) << NA_PowerDownMode_B )); // register value is rewritten completely
00958     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_EnableWakeUpDio_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableWakeUpDio_O]);
00959 
00960     // turn off BB clock
00961     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbClock_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableBbClock_B));
00962     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableBbClock_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbClock_O]);
00963     ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbClockGate_O] = (1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B) | (1 << NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_B);
00964     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_ResetBbClockGate_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_ResetBbClockGate_O]);
00965     ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~(1 << NA_EnableBbCrystal_B));
00966     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableBbCrystal_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableBbCrystal_O]);
00967 
00968     // go to power down mode
00969     ntrxShadowReg[NA_PowerDown_O] = (1 << NA_ResetBbRadioCtrl_B)
00970                                     | ( 1 << NA_ResetBbClockGate_B )
00971                                     | (1 << NA_PowerDown_B);
00972     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_PowerDown_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_PowerDown_O]);
00973 }
00974 
00975 /**
00976  * @brief enable diio[3:0] as output with 32khz
00977  */
00978 /**************************************************************************/
00979 void NTRXDioOutput32kHz( /* Dio[3:0] */ uint8_t bits)
00980 /**************************************************************************/
00981 {
00982 
00983 /* merged into one operation ...
00984     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O]     |=  (1<< NA_DioDirection_B);
00985     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioAlarmPolarity_O] &= ~(1 << NA_DioAlarmPolarity_B);
00986     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioAlarmPolarity_O] |=  (1 << NA_DioAlarmPolarity_B);
00987     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioUsePulldown_O]   |=  (1 << NA_DioUsePulldown_B);
00988 */
00989     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O] = 0x21;
00990 
00991     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, 0xf );
00992     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, 0);
00993 
00994     /* both registers are contained at same offset */
00995     ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioAlarmPolarity_O] |=  (1 << NA_DioAlarmPolarity_B);
00996 
00997 
00998     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioDirection_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_DioDirection_O]);
00999     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, bits );
01000     NTRXSPIWriteByte( NA_DioPortWe_O, 0);
01001 }
01002 
01003 /**************************************************************************/
01004 void NTRXRXEnable(bool_t enable)
01005 /**************************************************************************/
01006 {
01007     /*
01008     * start the receiver of the TRX chip
01009     */
01010     if (enable == TRUE && phyPIB.rxOn == FALSE)
01011     {
01012         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RxIntsReset_O, 0x7F);
01013         rxIrqStatus = 0;
01014 
01015         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RxCmdStart_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxCmdStart_O]
01016                                                 | (1 << NA_RxCmdStart_B)
01017                                                 | (1 << NA_RxBufferCmd_LSB)
01018                                                 | (1 << NA_RxBufferCmd_MSB)));
01019 
01020         phyPIB.rxOn = TRUE;
01021 
01022     }
01023     else if (enable == FALSE && phyPIB.rxOn == TRUE)
01024     {
01025         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RxCmdStop_O, (uint8_t)(ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxCmdStop_O]
01026                                             | (1 << NA_RxCmdStop_B)
01027                                             | (1 << NA_RxBufferCmd_LSB)
01028                                             | (1 << NA_RxBufferCmd_MSB)));
01029 
01030         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_RxIntsReset_O, 0x7F);
01031         phyPIB.rxOn = FALSE;
01032         rxIrqStatus = 0;
01033     }
01034 }
01035 
01036 
01037 /************************************************************************/
01038 uint8_t NTRXGetRssi( void )
01039 /************************************************************************/
01040 {
01041     CONST uint8_t threshold[] = {0x50, 0xE8, 0xE8, 0x00, 0x00};
01042     CONST uint8_t threshold2[] = {0x00, 0x8D, 0x8D, 0x8D, 0x8D};
01043     CONST uint8_t tmpBuffer[] = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0};
01044     uint8_t rssi;
01045 
01046     NTRXRXEnable( FALSE );
01047 
01048     // Sets SyncWord to 0 **
01049     NTRXSetSyncWord ( tmpBuffer );
01050 
01051     // CRC2 Type 1 / !FEC / TxRxCryptCrc2ModeUncrypted / TxRxCryptClkModeCryptClock
01052     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_Crc2Type_O, tmpBuffer[0] );
01053 
01054     // PulseDetDelay 7 **
01055     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_PulseDetDelay_O, (0x7 << NA_PulseDetDelay_LSB));
01056 
01057     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_AgcValue_O, 0x3f);
01058 
01059     // Do not Hold AGC / HoldAgcInBitSync = 0x7
01060     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_HoldAgcInBitSync_O, 0x07 );
01061 
01062     // Use Alternative AGC **
01063     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_UseAlternativeAgc_O, 0x05 );
01064 
01065     // Sets correlation threshold register to 0
01066     NTRXSetIndexReg (0x32);
01067     NTRXSPIWrite (0x80, threshold, 5);
01068     NTRXSetIndexReg (0x00);
01069 
01070     // Enable LO
01071     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableLO_O, 0x1);
01072     NTRXRXEnable( TRUE );
01073 
01074     HWDelayms( 1 ); /* measurement time */
01075     NTRXSPIReadByte(NA_AgcGain_O, &rssi);
01076     HWDelayus( 250 ); /* otherwise all hell breaks loose ... */
01077 
01078     /*restore previous configuration*/
01079     NTRXRXEnable( FALSE );
01080     NTRXSetSyncWord ( phyPIB.syncword );
01081     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_Crc2Type_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_Crc2Type_O] );
01082     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_PulseDetDelay_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_PulseDetDelay_O] );
01083     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_AgcValue_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_AgcValue_O] );
01084     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_HoldAgcInBitSync_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_HoldAgcInBitSync_O] );
01085     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_UseAlternativeAgc_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_UseAlternativeAgc_O] );
01086     NTRXSetIndexReg (0x32);
01087     NTRXSPIWrite (0x80, threshold2, 5);
01088     NTRXSetIndexReg (0x00);
01089     NTRXSPIWriteByte(NA_EnableLO_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_EnableLO_O] );
01090 
01091     if (phyPIB.rxState == PHY_RX_ON) NTRXRXEnable(TRUE);
01092 
01093     return( rssi );
01094 }
